cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-reinterpret-c.description:
Description

This check flags all uses of
reinterpret_cast
in C++ code.

Use of these casts can violate type safety and cause the program to access a
variable that is actually of type
X
to be accessed as if it were of an
unrelated type
Z
.

This rule is part of the
Type safety (Type.1.1)
profile from the C++ Core Guidelines.
cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-reinterpret-c.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
